jsymbolic2.gui

Class SymbolicMusicFilesTableModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.swing.table.AbstractTableModel
      • javax.swing.table.DefaultTableModel
        • jsymbolic2.gui.SymbolicMusicFilesTableModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, javax.swing.table.TableModel

    public class SymbolicMusicFilesTableModel
extends javax.swing.table.DefaultTableModel
    The table model used by the symbolic_music_files_table JTable in MusicFileSelectorPanel to list all symbolic music files from which features are to be extracted. The file path for each such file is listed in its own row, with one column for the file name and one for the file path. Provides methods to fill the table row by row and to delete everything in it. Makes all cells non-editable.
    Author:
    Cory McKay
    See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • resetAndFillTable

        public void resetAndFillTable(SymbolicMusicFile[] symbolic_music_files)
        Deletes everything in the table and then fills it up one row at a time based on the given symbolic_music_files.
        Parameters:
        symbolic_music_files - Files to include on the table, in the order that they are to be added to it. If this is null, then the table is simply cleared of any existing rows.

      • clearTable

        public void clearTable()
        Removes all rows in the table.

      • isCellEditable

        public boolean isCellEditable(int row,
                              int column)
        Returns false for all cells on the table, with the effect that no cells are editable.
        Specified by:
        isCellEditable in interface javax.swing.table.TableModel
        Overrides:

        Parameters:
        row - The table row to check.
        column - The table column to check.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the cell at the specified row and column is editable.
